JobFullDesc: At Raytheon Missiles & Defense, you have the opportunity to try new things and make a bigger difference across a broader end-to-end solution, a richer technology and product set, an expanded range of disciplines, a growing global footprint and a more diverse team of colleagues and customers.The Mechanical Products Team (MPT) is responsible for mechanical design, analysis, and test of all sensor and effector products across the RMD portfolio. The Mechanical Product Team uses state-of-the-art tools, processes, technology, and Raytheon Six Sigma principles.The Configuration and Data Management (CDM) organization is responsible for ensuring our products are under configuration control and delivered on time. The CDM Organization consists of multiple disciplines that support engineering, our program offices and our customers. Disciplines in the CDM organization participate in the life cycle of our products from conception to deactivation. The CDM organization is comprised of Effector CM(ECM), Data Management (DM/DEX), Software Configuration Management (SWCM), and Sensor CM (SCM).The Data Management, Engineering Support and Execution (DEX) department is looking for an individual to perform the role of Information System Owner (ISO).This position is located in Tucson, AZ The ISO is responsible for ensuring that all classified collateral Information Systems (IS) are operating in efficient compliance with Risk Management Framework (RMF) and Cyber security policies. The ISO provides a centralized authority and network of resources dedicated to the seamless integration of Information Technology (IT), Cybersecurity, and Program objectives. Moreover, the ISO delivers mission critical oversight and embedded Program support that ensures the universal application of best practices. Additionally, the ISO is responsible for addressing the operational interests of the user community while ensuring IS compliance with RMF requirements. At the Program level, the ISO plans, facilitates, and manages the IS development, budgeting, operations, maintenance, and security posture throughout its’ entire lifecycle. The ISO is an innovator, collaborating with all levels of Program Management; cultivating synergy between multidisciplinary functions to develop optimal IS solutions that satisfy requirements. Beyond maintaining IS integrity, the ISO also plays a vital role in the enforcement of policies regarding classified data handling, processing, and destruction.Responsibilities to anticipate:Ensuring
